name: Chicken Karahi
instructions: Heat oil in karahi on high heat
Add chicken with salt, cook 5 mins until lightly browned
Add ginger-garlic paste and whole green chilies, cook 1 minute
Add tomatoes and all spices, mix well
Cover and simmer on low heat for 20 minutes
Uncover and cook on high for 5-7 mins until gravy thickens
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or rice

name: Aloo Tamatar
instructions: Heat the oil or ghee in a large pan, wok (kadai), or pressure cooker over medium heat.
Add the onions and cook until golden brown.
Add the ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes and cook until they soften.
Add the potatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
Add all the spices and cook for 2 minutes.
Add water and cook until the potatoes are tender.
Garnish with hari_dhaniia and serve hot with roti or rice

name: Anday Ka Salan
instructions: Hard-boil the eggs, peel them, and make small slits in each egg so they can absorb the flavors of the curry. In a separate pan, you can lightly fry the eggs in a little oil with a pinch of turmeric and chili powder until golden brown, then set them aside.
In a large pan, heat oil and add onions. Cook until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomatoes and cook until they soften.
Add potatoes, all spices, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add water and cook until the potatoes are tender.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with roti or rice and add garam masala on top of the curry for extra flavor.

name: Anda Piyaaz
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a frying pan over medium-low heat. Add chopped onions and green chilies. Fry until the onions become soft and translucent.
Add chopped tomatoes (if using) and cook for 1 minute until they soften.
Add salt, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and cumin/coriander powder. Mix well and cook the masala for 2–3 minutes.
In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs with a little extra salt and black pepper (optional).
Pour the whisked eggs into the pan and lower the heat slightly.
Stir immediately for a scrambled texture, or let the eggs set slightly before breaking them apart.
Cook until the eggs are fully done and excess moisture dries out.
Garnish with fresh chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with chapati, roti, or bread.

name: Gajar Halwa
instructions: Wash, peel, and grate the carrots.
Heat ghee in a pan and add grated carrots.
Cook on medium heat until the carrots soften.
Add milk and cook, stirring occasionally, until the milk reduces.
Add sugar and cardamom powder and mix well.
Cook until the halwa thickens and ghee separates.
Garnish with dry fruits and serve warm.

name: Kachumber Salad
instructions: Finely chop tomatoes, cucumber, onions, and green chilies.
Add all chopped vegetables to a bowl.
Sprinkle salt, black salt, and chaat masala.
Add lemon juice and mix well.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve immediately.

name: Vegetable Pulao
instructions: Wash and soak rice for 20 minutes.
Heat oil in a pot and add cumin seeds, cloves, cardamom, and bay leaf.
Add onions and sauté until light golden.
Add vegetables and cook for 3–4 minutes.
Add rice, salt, and water. Mix gently.
Cover and cook on low heat until rice is fully cooked.
Fluff the rice and serve hot with raita.

name: Daal Chawal
instructions: Wash and boil daal with water and turmeric until soft
In separate pot, cook rice with salt
Heat oil in pan, add cumin seeds
Add tomatoes and green chilies, cook 2 mins
Pour over cooked daal, mix well
Serve daal with rice, garnish with coriander

name: Fruit Chaat
instructions: Chop all fruits into small pieces
Add fruits to a large bowl
Sprinkle salt, black salt, and chaat masala
Add lemon juice if using
Mix well and serve immediately

name: Aloo Gobi
instructions: Cut cauliflower and potatoes into medium pieces
Heat oil, add cumin seeds, let them splutter
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook 1 min
Add potatoes and cauliflower, stir well
Add tomatoes and all spices, mix
Cover and cook on low heat for 15-20 mins until tender
Garnish with coriander and serve with roti
